comments:
This issue is related to bug 102266 

When using a paerticular plugin (WOLips) with a project shared through a particular Team provider (Perforce) I get a "Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match outer scope rule: P/" error (stack trace below, if it helps).

The sequence of actions is emminently reproducible.

From bug 102266, it seems likely that a particular RuleFactory involved in the explicit sequence of actions is not overriding a specific method.

Is the stack trace below sufficient to disgnose the problem Factory (and indeed to confirm that the factory is at fault)? Or do I need to hassle the providers of the Team provider plugin or the WOLips plugin?

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match outer scope rule: P/Testing
        at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:62)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.illegalPush(ThreadJob.java:116)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.push(ThreadJob.java:225)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ImplicitJobs.begin(ImplicitJobs.java:80)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.beginRule(JobManager.java:219)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkManager.checkIn(WorkManager.java:96)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.prepareOperation(Workspace.java:1684)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.File.setContents(File.java:358)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.File.setContents(File.java:462)
        at org.objectstyle.wolips.jdt.ant.UpdateOtherClasspathIncludeFiles.buildIncludeFiles(UpdateOtherClasspathIncludeFiles.java:148)
        at org.objectstyle.wolips.jdt.ant.UpdateOtherClasspathIncludeFiles.execute(UpdateOtherClasspathIncludeFiles.java:89)
        at org.objectstyle.wolips.jdt.listener.UpdateIncludeFilesJob.runInWorkspace(UpdateIncludeFilesJob.java:90)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.InternalWorkspaceJob.run(InternalWorkspaceJob.java:38)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
This does no appear to be an Eclipse Platform problem. Since the exception trace mentions WOLips, that is probably the best place to send the trace.

traces.message: Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match outer scope rule: P/Testing
